name: A. Memory and Crow
statement:
There are integers written in a row. For all from to , values are
defined by the crows performing the following procedure: The crow sets
initially . The crow then adds to , subtracts , adds the number, and so
on until the ’th number. Thus, . Memory gives you the values , and he
now wants you to find the initial numbers written in the row? Can you do
it?
editorial: Note that a[i]?+?a[i?+?1]?=?b[i]. Use the initial condition b[n]?=?a[n] and we can figure out the entire array b.
